author: philcares

author: 3esmit.stateofus.eth
content: <@707707212184944702> not enough incentives for people running test nodes. Which is being a great opportunity to test the spec for this conditions. Due this, I reported one bug on spec, about honest validators having punishment, and also my nimbus node crashed with an error related to not -finality epochs.

content: See https://eth2stats.io/medalla-testnet, reference nodes are operating normally, is that just there is no enough votes to finalize blocks. You can also notice nimbus nodes stuck at block 515613

author: jgm
content: That's the committee size, so 63 votes aggregated of the 136 in the committee

author: 3esmit.stateofus.eth
content: And what's is the max size of that?

author: prestonvanloon
content: see https://github.com/ethereum/eth2.0-specs/blob/master/specs/phase0/beacon-chain.md#get_committee_count_per_slot

author: prestonvanloon
content: 128 is the max number of attestations in a single block, committee sizes are based on the number of active validators and there isnt a max size necessarily

author: tersec
content: the block root in question here, incidentally, is `5d6fc4e3`

content: I do wonder why the phase 0 spec, at least, doesn't seem to ever verify the max operations/block

author: prestonvanloon

content: but that's not at issue with these blocks

author: 3esmit.stateofus.eth
content: <@!654267572107083777> 515616 looks fully processed, the crash seems to happen when 515617 is being processed

author: prestonvanloon
content:
```python
class BeaconBlockBody(Container):
    randao_reveal: BLSSignature
    eth1_data: Eth1Data  # Eth1 data vote
    graffiti: Bytes32  # Arbitrary data
    # Operations
    proposer_slashings: List[ProposerSlashing, MAX_PROPOSER_SLASHINGS]
    attester_slashings: List[AttesterSlashing, MAX_ATTESTER_SLASHINGS]
    attestations: List[Attestation, MAX_ATTESTATIONS]
    deposits: List[Deposit, MAX_DEPOSITS]
    voluntary_exits: List[SignedVoluntaryExit, MAX_VOLUNTARY_EXITS]
```

SSZ enforces these list limits

author: tersec
content: oh, right

author: tersec
content:
```
DBG 2020-10-15 16:55:29.958+02:00 FOO: incorporating attestation             topics="attpool" tid=175380 file=fork_choice.nim:290 attestation_data="(slot: 515615, index: 17, beacon_block_root: \"738bcaf8\", source: (epoch: 15705, root: \"66ba71df\"), target: (epoch: 16112, root: \"727f3fd1\"))"
 peers: 3 ‚ùØ finalized: b3806428:15614 ‚ùØ head: 738bcaf8:16112:29 ‚ùØ time: 16218:0 (518976) ‚ùØ sync: UDUwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwww:3:0.0000 (515613) 
 :  FOO3: committees_per_slot = 17; index = 17; len(savi) = 73727
```
it's seeing an attestation which claims to be committee index 17, when that's not (apparently) valid

author: tersec
content: `len(savi)` is number of active validator indices

author: tersec
content: and `get_committee_count_per_slot(73727)` is indeed 17

author: 3esmit.stateofus.eth
content: <@!144468805697929216> mentioned that 515615 was skipped, does it matters?

author: tersec
content: it's not checked by `process_attestations()` in `process_operations()` it seems, because that'd trigger things earlier. that's what I'm still unsure about

author: 3esmit.stateofus.eth
content: so indeed the crash happens while processing 515616 (5d6fc4e3), sorry for the confusion.
